alert.note: Alert for Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 1:13PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of New Hanover, southern Pender and northeastern Brunswick Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 113 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hightsville, or near Leland, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Wrightsville Beach, Surf City, Figure Eight Island, Hampstead, Topsail Beach, Bishop, Hightsville, Cape Fear Community College North Campus, Wilmington International Airport, Murrayville, Masonboro, Castle Hayne, University Of North Carolina At Wilmington, Phoenix, Scotts Hill, Ogden, Woodside, and Mayfaire. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 409 and 416. Interstate 140 between mile markers 15 and 20. US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 39 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender
